intro: Pilogyne trullifolia, commonly known as the clustered pilogyne, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and vibrant, tubular flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal. Pilogyne trullifolia requires well-draining soil and consistent moisture to flourish.
